page.title: 02Mark's Crafts and Industries
page.content: At the East end of Mark on the Blackford Road are the{Saw Mills}of Ivor Morgan where wood comes in to be cut into pit props and other commercial needs. Opposite the Church Amesbury and Puddy have a{Blacksmith}business. Mr Amesbury is a{Farrier}and with so many ponies and riding hacks around he is kept very busy. Mr Creber's{Joinery}business is next door. His father owned the Joinery before him and was the village carpenter. He used to use local elm to make the goods but now it is usually Mahogany and other hardwood from S. America,making staircases and window- frames. Mr Creber's and Amesbury and Puddy's,together with Avery's Garage next door make up what was Wensley's Horse Drawn Waggon,Car and Wheelwright Works-an old local family business.
